page.title: 01Changes in Tenbury
page.content: We went to see Mrs Hewitt and these are the changes she told us.She has lived in Tenbury Wells since 1925 and she has lived in that very house since 1940.When she was smaller she remembered Bowketts Supermarket being just a butchers and the car park being built in 1950.Cross Street has always been the same and there were no houses up Terrills Lane until 1934 and there was nothing by the Catholic Church except a farm.Where there is now an estate called Greenhill Close there lived a man called Mr Godson and he lived in a house called The Court in the twenties.Tenbury Hospital also opened in the Twenties.
